column2: 6 Year Service
eSIF
Prepare for service
Do a check of the warning log.                                                                   OK
Tightening torque.                                                                                      OK
Functional safety test
Tower: Do a test of the emergency stop function from the tower.             OK
To do a test of the emergency stop buttons in the tower: Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S1 for the tower control cabinet.
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S6A for the tower
top in the tower.
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S6B for the tower
top in the tower.
Nacelle: Do a test to see if the emergency stop activates the brake.        OK
To do a test of the emergency stop buttons in the nacelle: Do the test of
the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S3 for the yaw control cabinet.
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S4 for the main shaft
(LSS).
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -610-02-S5 for the nacelle
control cabinet.
Do a check of the vibration sensor.                                                            OK
Hub and blades: To do a test of the emergency stop buttons in the hub: OK
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -135-S1 for the hub control
cabinet.
Do the test of the emergency stop buttons -135-S2 for the hub I/O box.  OK
Safety equipment
Do a check of the emergency rescue equipment according to the
checklist in the rescue box.
Examine the fire extinguishers.                                                                  OK
Note the date for the next inspection of the fire extinguishers. Date of
inspection:
Service technician’s initials:
Do a check of the first-aid kits according to the procedure mentioned in
the manual supplied along with the first-aid kits.
Fall arrest equipment (rail): Visually examine the fall protection rail and
the ladder for dents, holes, and cracks.
Examine all the bolts on the fall protection rail.                                         OK
Fall arrest equipment (wire): Examine the safety cable.                            OK
Examine the bottom bracket.                                                                     OK
Examine the ladder, the cable, and the cable guides.                               OK
Examine the top bracket.                                                                           OK
Do a check of the anchor points in the tower, nacelle, inside nacelle roof
and hub.
Rotor
Hub: ++05 Hub control cabinet: Do a check of the heating element.        OK
Visually check the hub control cabinet and the support brackets for
loose bolts or cracks in the brackets.
Do a test of the RCCB in the hub controller.                                              OK
Replace the 12 V backup battery in the ++05 hub control cabinet.           OK
Visually examine the 12 V batteries for leakage.                                       OK
Hub cover: Do a check of the fibreglass connections for loose bolts.       OK
Examine the nose cone for cracks in the fibreglass around the bolted
connections.
Blade bearing: Do a check of the blade bearing seals for leakage.
Semi-automatic lubrication system: To check the grease hoses: Do a
check of the grease hoses for cracks and wear.
Do a check of the grease hoses and their attachments for tightness.       OK
Do a check of the grease distribution block assembly and its attachment
for tightness.
Do a check of the grease collecting cans.                                                 OK
Lubricate the blade bearings.                                                                     OK
Blades: Examine the blades.                                                                     OK
Do a check of the blade collar.                                                                   OK
Do an internal inspection of the structural shell blade.                              OK
Do a check of the LCTU.                                                                            OK
Pitch system: Do a visual check to make sure that the blade pitch lock is
activated.
Visually examine the hub for leakage.                                                       OK
Do a check of the nitrogen pre-charge pressure in the pitch
accumulators.
Measured value:
New value after adjustment:
Measured value:
New value after adjustment:
Measured value:
New value after adjustment:
Measured value:
New value after adjustment:
To do a check of the cylinder holder bolts: Do a check of every third bolt
on each cylinder holder.
Torque:
Do a check of all the bolts in the rod-end flange.                                       OK
Do a check for the loose bolts in the wedge for automatic blade lock in
all 3 blades.
Do a check of the hydraulic cylinder piston rod for wear and damage.     OK
Do a check of the rod-protection covers on the piston rods for tear and
holes
To do a check of the slide bushings for the cylinders: Do a visual and
audio inspection of the axial clearance.
To do a check of the clearance in the bearing between the torque arm
shaft and the hydraulic cylinder: Do a visual and audio inspection of the
radial clearance.
Hydraulic systems
Nacelle hydraulics: Examine the hoses, the seals, the connections in
the nacelle, the main shaft, the hydraulic pump for hydraulic oil leakage.
Examine the hydraulic oil level.                                                                  OK
Extract a sample of the hydraulic oil.                                                         OK
Replace the filter element of the return line filter.                                      OK
Flush the hydraulic system after the filter change.                                    OK
Replace the air breather filter element.                                                      OK
Brake system: Do a test of the brake.                                                        OK
To do a visual inspection of the brake callipers: Do a visual inspection of
the brake callipers for cracks and other damage.
Do the visual inspection of the brake callipers, the pipes, and the hoses
for oil leakage.
Visually examine all the hydraulic piping inlets and outlets.                      OK
Do a check of the brake pads for thickness of the brake lining.                OK
Do a check to make sure that the wiring to the brake wear and heat
sensors in the brake pads is not damaged.
Gearbox and gear oil system
Gearbox: Do a check of the gear oil level.                                                 OK
Do a check of the joints, seals (pitch tube, input shaft, and output shaft)
and covers (including split line, ring gear flange on the rotor end side,
and non-rotor end side) for leakage.
Do an inspection of the gearbox for debris.                                               OK
Extract the gear oil sample.                                                                       OK
Replace the filter cartridge in the air filter housing.                                    OK
Gear oil system: Do a visual inspection of the gear oil hoses for damage
or leakage.
Replace the offline filter and the O-rings in the gearbox.                           OK
To replace the 2 inline 10 μm gear oil filters (filter block HG1270):
Replace the 2 inline 10 μm gear oil filters and the O-rings.
Visually examine all the fittings, components on the filter block, and the
pumps for leakage.
Main shaft arrangement: Examine the bearing for unusual noise.            OK
To lubricate the main bearings: Lubricate the main bearing without an
automatic grease lubrication system.
Lubricate the main bearing with an automatic grease lubrication system.OK
Do a check and adjust the LSS or RPM sensors.                                      OK
To examine the rotor locking pins: Do a visual inspection of the rotor
locking pins and the rotor lock disc holes for damage.
Lubricate the rotor locking pins.                                                                 OK
Torque arm system: Do a check of the 4 bolts in the integrated torque
arm or gear connection on each side.
Torque:
Pressure:
Do a check of both the integrated torque arms for visible cracks.             OK
Do a check of the upper and the lower rubber vibration elements or
rubber dampers for visible cracks on both the torque arms.
Do a check for play in the vibration elements or the rubber dampers.      OK
Visually examine to make sure that the earthing cables that connects
the gearbox and main foundation not damaged.
Generator and coupling
Generator: Do a check of the bearings for unusual noise.                        OK
Do a check of the automatic lubrication system.                                       OK
Do a check to see if the grease return pipe is blocked.                             OK
Do a check of the lubrication pump for tightness.                                      OK
Do a check of the power slip ring system.                                                 OK
Measure all ground brushes:                                                                     OK
Do a check of the form and function of the ground brushes.                     OK
Identify the power brush type: Mersen
Identify the power brush type: BGB                                                           OK
Measure the most worn power brush:                                                        OK
Do a check of the form and function of the power brushes.                      OK
Identify the slip ring unit type: Mersen
Identify the slip ring unit type: BGB                                                            OK
Do a check of the slip ring surfaces.                                                          OK
Do a check and measure the groove depth for the power brushes.          OK
Power brush – 1:                                                                                        4,700
Power brush – 2:                                                                                        3,600
Power brush – 3:                                                                                        3,500
To check the suction fan and the filter for the PSRS: Do a check of the
suction fan, the filter, and the exhaust hose fitting.
HS coupling: Do a check of the connecting tube.                                      OK
Do a check of the discs.                                                                             OK
Examine the tightness of all the bolts.                                                       OK
Cooling and conditioning
To do a check of the liquid cooling system: Do a visual inspection of the
circulation pump -690-02-G1 for leakage in the shaft seal.
Do a check of the 2 hoses in the front end for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.
Do a check of the 2 hoses in the ILU pipe system for incipient cracks,
wear, and leakage.
Do a check of the 5 hoses in the pump area for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.
Do a check of the 2 hoses on column 3 (right-hand side) for incipient
cracks, wear, and leakage.
Do a check of the 3 hoses for the roof section for incipient cracks, wear,
and leakage.
Do a check of the 2 hoses in the rear end for incipient cracks, wear, and
leakage.
CoolerTop®: Do a check of the CoolerTop® ladder for loose or missing
bolts.
Visually examine the fibreglass for cracks along the leading edge.          OK
Visually examine the cooler elements on the CoolerTop® for damage
through the skylight.
Nacelle
Safety functions: Examine the parking brake.                                           OK
Do a test of the shock sensor.                                                                   OK
Nacelle controller cabinets: To do a check of the ++03 CON A controller
section: Do a test of the heating element.
Do a test of the safety system batteries.                                                    OK
Do a check of the fan and the air filters.                                                    OK
To do a check of the ++53 CON B controller section: Do a test of the
heating element.
Do a check of the fan and the air filters.                                                    OK
Replace the safety system batteries.                                                         OK
To do a check of the ++04++3 busbar cabinet: Do a test of the heating
element.
Do a check of the fan and the air filters.                                                    OK
Do a test of the main circuit breakers (-405-04-F1, -400-04-F1, and
To do a check of the ++04++1 VCS converter cabinet: Do a test of the
heating element.
Do a check of the air filter.                                                                         OK
Rotating transfer unit: To do a check of the slip ring unit (BGB): Visually
examine the slip ring unit for burns and excessive dust.
Do a visual check of the brushes for burns and wear.                               OK
To do a check of the slip ring unit (REKOFA): Visually examine the slip
ring unit for burns and excessive dust.
Do a visual check of the brushes for burns and wear.                               OK
Nacelle cover: Do a check of the bolts in the nacelle cover assembly for
any loose or missing bolts.
Do a check of all the fittings to the nacelle cover for cracks.                     OK
Do a check of the fibreglass for cracks around the fittings.                       OK
Do a check of the fibreglass very carefully for cracks at points of
attachment.
To do a check of the anchor points: Do a check of the anchor points.      OK
Do a check of all the bolted connections of the outer anchor points.        OK
Do a check of the anchor points for cracks.                                               OK
Wind sensor: Clean the wind sensor.                                                        OK
Visually examine the cables for damage and wear.                                  OK
Examine all the wind sensor equipment, the brackets, and the masts for
severe damage.
Do a check of all the wind sensor equipment, the brackets, and the
masts for tightness.
Yaw system
Yaw bearing system: Measure the radial backlash.                                  OK
Claw beam number 1: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 1: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 2: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 2: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 3: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 3: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 4: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 4: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 5: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 5: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 6: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 6: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 7: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 7: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 8: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 8: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 9: CW end:                                                                 0,050
Claw beam number 9: CCW end:                                                              0,050
Claw beam number 10: CW end:                                                               0,050
Claw beam number 10: CCW end:                                                            0,050
Claw beam number 11: CW end:                                                               0,050
Claw beam number 11: CCW end:                                                            0,050
Sum: CW end:                                                                                            0,550
Sum: CCW end:                                                                                         0,550
Do a check of the bolts for the end-stop (brass or aluminium piece) for
the radial slide plates.
Do a check of spring packages on each yaw beam.                                 OK
Do a check of the yaw teeth for wear and damage.                                  OK
Yaw lubrication system: Manually lubricate the yaw sliding surface.         OK
Do a check of the automatic lubrication of the yaw sliding surface.          OK
To do the automatic lubrication of the yaw teeth: Fill the grease
reservoir on the lubrication pump.
Do a check of the lubrication system.                                                        OK
Examine if all the lubrication wheels are in engagement with the yaw
pinion or the yaw ring.
Yaw gear and motor: Do a check of the oil level in the planetary gears
and in the worm gears.
Do a check and adjust the brake torque of 2 of the 6 yaw gear motors.
Measured value before adjustment: Left front
Measured value before adjustment: Right front
Measured value before adjustment: Left rear
Measured value before adjustment: Right rear
Measured value before adjustment: Left middle
Measured value before adjustment: Right middle
New value after adjustment: Left front
New value after adjustment: Right front
New value after adjustment: Left rear
New value after adjustment: Right rear
New value after adjustment: Left middle
New value after adjustment: Right middle
Do a check for noise or vibration from the yaw gear bearing.                   OK
Do a check if the yaw gears run smoothly.                                                OK
Service crane
Examine the service crane.                                                                        OK
High voltage
Do an inspection of the transformer, the transformer room, and the HV
switchgear.
Service lift and climb assistance
Do a check of the service lift and the climb assistance according to the
supplier’s user manual.
Tower
Tower: Visually examine the grout and concrete for cracks, scaling, and
such like on the outer and inner side of the tower.
To do a check of the anchor bolts in the anchor cage foundation:
Visually examine the bolt protection caps.
Visually examine all the anchor bolts for corrosion and/or visible
damage.
To do an inspection of the tower flange bolts: Visually examine for
missing, broken, or loose tower flange bolts, corrosion protection on the
tower flange bolts and in the tower flange area, and water leakage in
the tower flanges.
Do a visual check of the ventilation filter at the door of the tower.             OK
Do a check of the tower inside and outside for damage.                           OK
To do a visual inspection of the middle section liquid damper (optional):
Do a visual inspection of the liquid level in the barrels.
Do a visual inspection of the barrels for liquid leakage.
Do a visual inspection of the mechanical components of the damper
units and wires.
To do a check of the functionality of the dehumidifier (optional): Do a
check of the function, filter, installation, and state of the connection hose
if the tower is installed with a dehumidifier.
Do a check for possible corrosion and dust (in the steel components).    OK
Tower surface treatment: Do a check of the surface protection of the
tower.
Cable and earthing system: Visually examine the cables for damage
and wear.
Do a check of the Vestas earthing system.                                               OK
++06 UPS cabinet: Do a check of the settings of the timers and the
temperature control devices according to the relay setting document.
See 0052-0741 ’Relay setting for V100/V110 2,2 MW VCS/VCSS Mk
Do a check of the MCBs.                                                                           OK
Visually examine the UPS battery cartridges and the UPS battery packs
for leakage.
To do a test of the UPS batteries: Do a test of the UPS batteries.            OK
Replace the UPS batteries, if necessary. Date (as a comment)
Replace the UPS, if necessary. Date (as a comment).
Do a check of the heating elements.                                                          OK
Examine the fan.                                                                                        OK
Do a check of the air filters in the UPS cabinet.                                        OK
++01 Ground control cabinet: Do a test of all processor backup batteries
in all the cabinets.
Examine if the heating elements are activated.                                         OK
RCBOs and RCCBs.
Do a check of the contactor switching counter for contactors -695-02-Q1
and -695-04-Q1 for number of switching.
Number of switching:
++51 Light box: Examine the RCCB ++51-640-02-03-F1 inside the ++51
light system control panel.
Visually examine the 12 V batteries for leakage.                                       OK
Examine the function of the emergency light and the 12 V batteries.        OK
Do a check of the air filter in the light box cabinet.                                    OK
Finish work
Clean the cabinets, the covers, and the other surfaces for grease spots
and finger marks.
Clean grease from the checker plates and the other surfaces.                 OK
Remove the collected grease from the yaw top teeth.                               OK
Clean the tower basement and tower from inside.                                    OK
